main event: A commercial pilot spotted a saucer-shaped object moving at high speed over Boise, Idaho on September 23, 1952.
interesting points: The object was approximately 50 feet in diameter, silvery in color, and reflecting sunlight,The object was traveling at an estimated speed of 420 knots (about 480 mph) in an east to west direction, about 1,500 feet above the pilot's aircraft.,After several minutes, the object disappeared at a very high rate of speed.,An ADIZ (Air Defense Identification Zone) scramble was ordered, but the object was not seen again.,The report states that there was insufficient data for evaluation' of the sighting.
